column1: The Deeping Wall was the solid stone wall
column2: some twenty feet in height and thick enough that four men could walk abreast along the top
column3: that defended the refuges of the Rohirrim at Helms Deep. It lay beneath the castle of the Hornburg
column4: to which it was connected by a flight of steps. In the Battle of the Hornburg (on 3 March
column5: ) it was breached for the only time in its history by a besieging army of Orcs and Dunlendings
column6: but they were soon driven back and defeated.
